name: K-array Firenze KS7P I
headline: Passive dual 21" engine for Firenze grids
description: KS7P I is the passive low-frequency backbone for Firenze touring systems, coupling dual 21-inch woofers to external DSP amplification for stadium-scale bass.
story: Paired with Firenze KH7P I line arrays and KA208LIVE amplification, KS7P I lets system designers park enormous low-end headroom beneath compact, steerable tops while keeping everything in a visually minimal footprint.
definition: Dual 21" passive Firenze subwoofer for touring and large-format installs.
finish: Touring black polyurea on steel frame

lifestyle.alt: Firenze KS7P I subwoofers under touring array
Side view of stacked Firenze KS7P I modules
Firenze KS7P I rigged in touring configuration

specs: Format: dual 21" passive subwoofer for Firenze touring systems
Transducers: 2 x 21" neodymium cone drivers with long-excursion motor
Optimised to be driven by Firenze-series Kommander amplifiers with FIR processing
Frequency response 25 Hz – 120 Hz (-6 dB) with system presets
Large, symmetrical ports and closed architecture minimise turbulence and noise
Rigging interfaces match Firenze line-array frames for neat grids

name: K-array Firenze KS7
headline: Self-powered dual 21" sub for arenas and stadiums
description: KS7 is a self-powered Firenze subwoofer voiced for long-throw arenas, arenas, and outdoor stages where extended, controlled low end is non-negotiable.
story: With dual 21-inch drivers, integrated Class D power and Firenze DSP, KS7 locks seamlessly to KH7 and KH8 arrays to create a single, steerable acoustic system that stays precise even at festival SPL.
definition: Self-powered dual 21" Firenze subwoofer for extreme SPL venues.
drivers: 2 x 21" neodymium drivers with high-power voice coils

lifestyle.alt: Firenze KS7 touring stack front view
Firenze KS7 deployed under main line array

specs: Format: self-powered dual 21" Firenze subwoofer
High-power Class D amplification with advanced DSP presets
Frequency response 25 Hz – 120 Hz (-6 dB) with Firenze processing
Optimised to anchor KH7 and KH8 arrays in large-format systems
Weather-resistant touring enclosure with integrated handles
Networkable control for delay, EQ and array optimisation

name: K-array Firenze KS8
headline: Compact self-powered IPAL sub with straight line array geometry
description: KS8 is a compact, self-powered subwoofer using IPAL® technology for precise, high-headroom low frequencies in touring rigs and large-scale events.
story: With dual 21" IPAL transducers, zero-latency DSP and powerful onboard amplification, KS8 can be flown or ground-stacked under Firenze arrays to deliver astonishingly tight, long-throw bass with sophisticated beam control options.
definition: Self-powered straight line array subwoofer using IPAL® technology.

lifestyle.alt: Firenze KS8 flown beneath Firenze line arrays
Side view of Firenze KS8 enclosure
Firenze KS8 stacked in touring configuration

specs: Format: self-powered straight line array subwoofer with dual 21" drivers
Integrated IPAL® amplifier module with differential pressure sensing
Zero-latency DSP for precise phase and amplitude control
Frequency response 28 Hz – 120 Hz (-6 dB) with Firenze presets
Weather-resistant design suitable for outdoor festivals
EASE Focus integration for cardioid and virtual arc configurations

name: K-array Firenze KH7P I
headline: Passive 3D steerable slim line array element
description: KH7P I is the passive Firenze line-array element that brings 3D beam steering to large-format touring systems when paired with dedicated amplification.
story: Leveraging Firenze Slim Array Technology and external DSP, KH7P I lets system engineers sculpt coverage vertically and horizontally while keeping a minimal visual footprint and rock-solid mechanical frames.
definition: Passive digitally steerable line-array module for Firenze systems.
finish: Black Firenze frame with stainless steel grille
coverage: Digitally steerable vertical and horizontal coverage

lifestyle.alt: Firenze KH7P I line array in arena deployment
Front view of Firenze KH7P I elements
Side detail of Firenze KH7P I frame
Firenze KH7P I stacked for transport

specs: Format: passive slim line-array element for Firenze touring grids
Transducers: 4 x 12" coaxial neodymium woofers in SAT configuration
Designed for external multi-channel DSP amplification and beam steering
High peak SPL with compact frontal area and shallow depth
Compatible with Firenze rigging frames for fast straight or curved hangs
Ideal companion to KS7/KS7P I and KS8 low-frequency modules

name: K-array Firenze KH8
headline: Top-of-the-line self-powered touring array
description: KH8 is Firenze’s flagship touring element, a self-powered, weather-resistant line array with electronic beam steering and extraordinary output.
story: With integrated multi-channel amplification and onboard DSP, KH8 flies in perfectly straight hangs while still sculpting coverage, dramatically reducing rigging time compared to traditional curved arrays.
definition: Self-powered, digitally steerable touring line-array element.
drivers: Multi-way array with 8 discrete amplifier channels
coverage: Digitally steered vertical coverage, wide horizontal dispersion
specs: Format: self-powered touring line-array element with 8-channel onboard amplification
Slim Array Technology (SAT) for tight impulse response and clarity
Electronic Beam Steering for focused coverage and reduced spill
Frequency response 70 Hz – 18 kHz (-6 dB) with Firenze presets
Weather-resistant enclosure with integrated rigging system
Perfect partner to Firenze KS8 and KS7 low-frequency modules

name: K-array Firenze KX12F I
headline: Coaxial 12" array element to complement Firenze low-end
description: KX12F I is a stainless-steel coaxial point-source element that slots into Firenze systems as a compact, high-impact mid-high box.
story: Its rotatable waveguide and 12" + compression driver format let designers tighten coverage over dance floors, terraces and infill zones while keeping the visual story in line with the Firenze sub arrays.
definition: 12" coaxial stainless-steel array element for Firenze ecosystems.
finish: Stainless steel cabinet with wide-mesh grille

lifestyle.alt: Firenze KX12F I flown above stage
Firenze KX12F I close-up of grille and waveguide
Firenze KX12F I in side-hung array

specs: Format: coaxial point-source / array element for Firenze systems
Transducers: 12" woofer + 1.7" compression driver on shared axis
Adjustable waveguide for 30°–90° vertical or horizontal dispersion
Frequency response ~120 Hz – 18 kHz (-6 dB) with system processing
Stainless steel cabinet with discreet wide-mesh grille
Dual NL4 connectors for pass-through and flexible wiring

name: K-array Rumble KU26
headline: Slim dual 6" sub for invisible bass under walls and benches
description: KU26 is an ultra-compact passive subwoofer with a 6" woofer and 6" passive radiator, designed to hide in millwork while still extending small systems down into true sub-bass.
story: Used alongside Lyzard, Vyper, Tornado or Anakonda columns, the stainless-steel KU26 tucks into coves and risers so designers get full-range response without a visible, boxy subwoofer anywhere in sight.
definition: Ultra-slim passive subwoofer with 6" driver and radiator.
finish: Stainless steel with textured paint or custom RAL
drivers: 1 x 6" neodymium woofer + 1 x 6" passive radiator
specs: Format: ultra-slim passive subwoofer companion for small column systems
Transducers: 6" neodymium woofer + 6" passive radiator
Frequency response 45 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with KA presets
Selectable impedance for daisy-chaining multiple KU26 on a single channel
Fully sealed stainless-steel chassis for demanding environments
Ideal for bars, lounges, galleries and discreet residential bass

name: K-array Rumble KU44 I
headline: Array-able 4x4" bass element for slender low-end columns
description: KU44 I is a stainless-steel, line-source subwoofer with four 4-inch transducers arranged for slim column bass that can be flown beside mid-high arrays.
story: Stack KU44 I modules behind or beside Kobra, Kayman or Vyper columns to build a truly invisible full-range line source that still carries serious LF energy to the back rows.
definition: Ultra-thin, array-able passive bass element.
finish: Brushed stainless steel or custom RAL
drivers: 2 x 4" neodymium woofers + 2 x 4" passive radiators

lifestyle.alt: Rumble KU44 I compact line-source sub
Rumble KU44 I with matching columns
Rumble KU44 I close grille texture
Rumble KU44 I in hospitality venue

specs: Format: ultra-thin array-able bass element for line-source systems
Transducers: 2 x 4" neodymium woofers + 2 x 4" passive radiators
Frequency response 50 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with KA-series amplification
Selectable 8/32 Ω impedance for long strings of KU44 on a single channel
All-steel construction, fully sealed and marine compliant
Discreet visual profile for worship spaces, galleries and hospitality

name: K-array Rumble KU210
headline: Ultra-thin 10" sub that disappears into architecture
description: KU210 is a high-power passive subwoofer combining a 10" neodymium driver with a 10" passive radiator in an ultra-shallow steel box.
story: It slides behind banquettes, under stages or along walls, extending K-array Installed Sound systems down into true sub-bass while remaining visually invisible and immune to dust, sand and spray.
definition: Ultra-thin, high-performance 10" subwoofer module.
finish: Stainless steel with black or white finish
drivers: 1 x 10" neodymium woofer + 1 x 10" passive radiator
specs: Format: ultra-thin passive subwoofer for Installed Sound Series
Transducers: 10" neodymium woofer + 10" passive radiator in sealed cabinet
Frequency response 40 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with KA presets
Rated power ~320 W with peak SPL around 127 dB
All-steel, fully sealed chassis suitable for harsh environments
Selectable low-impedance operation for flexible amplifier loading

name: K-array Rumble KU212
headline: Dual 12" ultra-slim sub for medium and large projects
description: KU212 doubles the driver complement to a 12" woofer and 12" passive radiator, creating a stainless steel subwoofer suited to clubs, cinemas and live rooms.
story: Designed as a companion to K-array Installed Sound tops, KU212 hides along walls and under platforms while delivering the extended 35 Hz–150 Hz response needed for premium hospitality and live venues.
definition: Ultra-thin, high-power passive subwoofer with 12" engine.
finish: Stainless steel with black or white finishes
drivers: 1 x 12" neodymium woofer + 1 x 12" passive radiator
specs: Format: ultra-thin passive subwoofer with 12" transducer and passive radiator
Frequency response 35 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with KA amplifier presets
Rated for medium and large-format projects such as clubs and cinemas
Sealed stainless-steel enclosure with high environmental resistance
Selectable impedance to allow multiple KU212 units per amplifier channel
Ideal low-frequency partner for K-array Installed Sound tops

name: K-array Rumble KU315
headline: Flagship 3x15" Rumble sub for outdoor and large venues
description: KU315 is the most powerful passive Rumble subwoofer, combining a 15" neodymium woofer with two 15" passive radiators in a shallow polyurea-coated cabinet.
story: Certified for marine and outdoor installs, KU315 brings true large-format low end to terraces, arenas and auditoria while still keeping a surprisingly slim frontal profile and simple SpeakON connectivity.
definition: Ultra-thin, high-power 15" subwoofer with dual passive radiators.
drivers: 1 x 15" neodymium woofer + 2 x 15" passive radiators

lifestyle.alt: Rumble KU315 grille and port detail

specs: Format: ultra-thin, high-power passive subwoofer with 15" driver + dual 15" passive radiators
Frequency response ~35 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with KA presets
Nominal power handling around 2000 W @ 4 Ω with up to ~137 dB peak SPL
Polyurea-coated birch plywood cabinet certified for outdoor and marine use
Sealed alignment with passive radiators for low noise and full environmental sealing
Ideal for large clubs, theatres, auditoria and outdoor terraces

name: K-array Truffle KTR24
headline: Pocket-sized aluminium subwoofer for ultra-discreet installs
description: Truffle KTR24 is a tiny aluminium subwoofer designed to sit under furniture, steps or millwork, extending compact systems down to real 45 Hz low end.
story: Paired with ultra-small Lyzard or Tornado satellites, KTR24 turns high-design spaces and hotel suites into full-range listening rooms without any visible sub cabinets.
definition: Passive micro subwoofer with 4" driver and passive radiator.
specs: Format: compact passive aluminium subwoofer
Transducers: 4" woofer paired with 4" passive radiator
Frequency response 45 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) when processed with KA amplifiers
Tiny footprint ideal for hospitality suites and residential joinery
2-pin Euroblock connector for neat architectural wiring
Available in black as standard with optional custom finishes

name: K-array Truffle KTR25
headline: Cylindrical sub that hides in joinery and risers
description: Truffle KTR25 uses a short cylindrical enclosure with a 5.25" active driver and matching passive radiator to create a compact omnidirectional low-frequency source.
story: Originally voiced to underpin Azimut KAMUT2L systems, KTR25 is equally at home nested in plinths, walls and steps, providing warm, controlled low end wherever interior designers want sound but not boxes.
definition: Passive cylindrical subwoofer with 5.25" active + passive drivers.

lifestyle.alt: Truffle KTR25 installed in wall niche
Truffle KTR25 in living room installation

specs: Format: passive cylindrical subwoofer for hidden low-frequency reinforcement
Transducers: 5.25" active driver with matching 5.25" passive radiator
Frequency response around 45 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) when paired with KA processing
Designed to remain unseen in plinths, risers and cabinetry
Provides the low end for Azimut-KAMUT2L14 and similar systems
Aluminium cylinder with discreet finish for architectural integration

name: K-array Truffle KTR26
headline: Largest compact Truffle for sustained low-end in bigger rooms
description: KTR26 is the largest compact Truffle, using a 6.5" active driver plus passive radiators in a longer cylinder to provide deeper, more sustained bass for premium spaces.
story: For high-end lounges, restaurants and villas that need low-end presence but refuse visible subs, KTR26 disappears into architecture while filling the room with effortless 45 Hz weight.
definition: Passive 6.5" cylindrical subwoofer with omnidirectional output.

lifestyle.alt: Truffle KTR26 hidden behind wall panel
Truffle KTR26 side profile of cylinder

specs: Format: passive cylindrical subwoofer for high-end architectural installs
Transducers: 6.5" active driver with symmetrical passive radiator loading
Frequency response 45 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with KA amplifier presets
Omnidirectional low-frequency dispersion from cylindrical form factor
Aluminium-alloy cylinder designed to be concealed in structure
Ideal for lounges, restaurants and premium residential theatres

name: K-array Thunder KS1 I
headline: Ultra-compact 4" installation sub for tight spaces
description: Thunder KS1 I is the smallest Thunder installation subwoofer, built around a long-throw 4" driver to provide surprising bass from an enclosure that disappears into joinery.
story: Think boutique hotel rooms, lounges and galleries where a full Thunder stack would be overkill but the client still wants K-array definition and punch under 80 Hz.
definition: Ultra-compact passive installation subwoofer.

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS1 I hidden in cabinet
Thunder KS1 I flush wall install
Thunder KS1 I rear connection panel

specs: Format: ultra-compact passive installation subwoofer
Transducer: 4" long-throw neodymium driver in optimised bandpass alignment
Frequency response ~70 Hz – 200 Hz (-6 dB) with matched processing
Lightweight enclosure that hides in small cavities and joinery
Supplied with installation brackets for wall or ceiling mounting
Ideal for premium hospitality and residential background systems

name: K-array Thunder KS1P I
headline: Active 4" installation sub with built-in DSP
description: KS1P I takes the tiny KS1 I form factor and adds integrated amplification and DSP for plug-and-play installation projects.
story: For design offices and hospitality rooms that need a simple, single-box low-end solution, KS1P I offers Thunder voicing and control without external amps or racks.
definition: Ultra-compact active installation subwoofer with DSP.

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS1P I in hotel room
Thunder KS1P I front grille close-up

specs: Format: ultra-compact active installation subwoofer
Transducer: 4" long-throw neodymium driver with internal amplification
Onboard DSP presets to match K-array installation satellites
Frequency response ~70 Hz – 200 Hz (-6 dB) for compact systems
Simplified connectivity for integrators (mains + line level in)
Perfect for hotel rooms, lounges and office fit-outs

name: K-array Thunder KS2 I
headline: Medium-format 12" Thunder sub for full-range installs
description: KS2 I is the workhorse Thunder installation subwoofer, centred on a 12" driver for club-level output in a still-compact box.
story: From restaurant main rooms to smaller clubs and theatres, KS2 I delivers proper chest hit and extension while staying slim enough to integrate cleanly into interiors.
definition: 12" passive installation subwoofer.

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS2 I in club installation

specs: Format: medium-format passive installation subwoofer
Transducer: 12" long-throw driver tuned for musical punch and extension
Frequency response ~38 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder presets
Multiple rigging and mounting options for installation flexibility
Compatible with Kommander amplifiers and Thunder processing
Ideal for clubs, bars and performance venues needing strong LF foundation

name: K-array Thunder KS2P I
headline: Active 12" Thunder install sub with built-in power
description: KS2P I wraps the KS2 I acoustic platform with internal amplification and DSP, making it a self-contained low-frequency solution.
story: For projects where external amps are undesirable or rack space is tight, KS2P I brings serious Thunder punch with a direct mains + signal hook-up.
definition: 12" self-powered Thunder installation subwoofer.

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS2P I rear amp plate

specs: Format: 12" self-powered installation subwoofer
Transducer: 12" long-throw driver with integrated amplification and DSP
Frequency response ~38 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) using factory presets
Onboard control for level, crossover and basic EQ
Simplified cabling – only mains power and audio feed required
Ideal for bars, lounges and venues without central amp racks

name: K-array Thunder KS3 I
headline: High-output 15" Thunder sub for live and club installs
description: KS3 I scales Thunder up to a 15" driver, ready for modern club and live performance SPL from a compact but muscular enclosure.
story: It forms the backbone of many Thunder-based systems, pairing with Vyper, Kayman or Mugello tops to create coherent, high-impact front-of-house rigs.
definition: High-output 15" passive installation subwoofer.

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS3 I top panel detail
Thunder KS3 I in live venue
Thunder KS3 I stack of subs

specs: Format: 15" high-output passive subwoofer
Transducer: 15" long-throw neodymium driver with high power handling
Frequency response ~32 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder presets
Compact yet powerful footprint suited to clubs and live rooms
Multiple rigging points for flown or ground-stacked deployments
Pairs with Thunder KS series and K-array tops for full-range systems

name: K-array Thunder KS3P I
headline: Self-powered 15" Thunder sub with serious headroom
description: KS3P I adds internal amplification and DSP to the KS3 I platform, turning it into a fully self-contained 15" Thunder engine.
story: When integrators need big-club energy without external amp racks, KS3P I provides plug-and-play low end that can be tuned on board or via matching K-array control.
definition: Self-powered 15" Thunder installation/touring subwoofer.

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS3P I in theatre install

specs: Format: 15" self-powered installation/touring subwoofer
Transducer: 15" driver with integrated Class D amplification
Frequency response ~32 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) via Thunder presets
Onboard DSP with selectable crossover and alignment presets
Ideal for clubs and performance spaces needing amp-less LF solutions
Compatible with K-array remote control and monitoring ecosystems

name: K-array Thunder KS4 I
headline: Large-format Thunder sub to anchor sizeable rooms
description: KS4 I is a large-format Thunder installation subwoofer, voiced to handle the heavy lifting in theatres, larger clubs and performance halls.
story: It provides deep extension and high SPL capability while maintaining the controlled, musical character Thunder subs are known for, making it a natural anchor in multi-way systems.
definition: Large-format passive Thunder installation subwoofer.
drivers: High-excursion LF driver in optimised enclosure

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS4 I stage edge install

specs: Format: large-format passive Thunder subwoofer
High-excursion LF platform optimised for deep extension and impact
Frequency response ~30 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder processing
Designed for theatres, performance spaces and large clubs
Multiple rigging and placement options for installation flexibility
Matches visually and sonically with Thunder KS series tops and subs

name: K-array Thunder KS4P I
headline: Self-powered large-format Thunder install sub
description: KS4P I brings active electronics to the KS4 I platform, offering large-room Thunder performance from a single powered enclosure.
story: Ideal where you want serious low-end headroom but minimal rack hardware, KS4P I covers theatres and big hospitality spaces with controlled, musical bass.
definition: Large-format active Thunder installation subwoofer.
drivers: High-excursion LF driver with onboard amplification

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS4P I rear amp panel
Thunder KS4P I detail of cooling vents

specs: Format: self-powered large-format Thunder subwoofer
High-power amplifier module with matched DSP onboard
Frequency response ~30 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder presets
Simplified cabling, with power and audio only
Perfect for large hospitality, theatres and performance venues
Integrates into Thunder / Kommander control ecosystems

name: K-array Thunder KS5P I
headline: Flagship self-powered Thunder sub for extreme installs
description: KS5P I sits at the top of the Thunder range, a self-powered installation subwoofer voiced for the most demanding live and club environments.
story: When very large rooms, EDM clubs or show venues need uncompromising Thunder low end from an installation-grade enclosure, KS5P I delivers the headroom and control expected of a flagship model.
definition: Flagship self-powered Thunder installation subwoofer.
drivers: High-displacement LF platform with large motor structure

lifestyle.alt: Thunder KS5P I in large club

specs: Format: flagship self-powered Thunder installation subwoofer
High-displacement LF engine designed for extreme SPL applications
Frequency response ~28 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder presets
Onboard DSP for crossover, delay and voicing options
Engineered for large clubs, show venues and special event spaces
Matches other Thunder KS series aesthetics for cohesive stacks

name: K-array Thunder KSC12P
headline: Compact 12" Thunder cube for tight-footprint bass
description: KSC12P is a compact 12" Thunder subwoofer in a cube-like cabinet, ideal where the footprint needs to stay small but low frequencies still matter.
story: Slide KSC12P under low stages, inside furniture or beneath DJ consoles to give systems a proper 12" foundation without visually dominating the space.
definition: Compact 12" passive Thunder subwoofer.
specs: Format: compact passive Thunder subwoofer with 12" driver
Frequency response ~32 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder presets
Cube-like footprint ideal for hiding in tight spaces
Compatible with Kommander amplifiers for voicing and protection
Used in club fills, DJ booths and compact live rigs
Rugged cabinet with Thunder-series styling

name: K-array Thunder KSC18P
headline: Compact 18" Thunder cube for deep, room-filling bass
description: KSC18P scales the KSC concept up to an 18" driver, delivering deep, room-filling bass from a still-manageable cube enclosure.
story: For premium lounges, theatre underbalconies and immersive rooms that demand serious low-end yet minimal visual presence, KSC18P is the natural Thunder choice.
definition: Compact 18" passive Thunder subwoofer.
specs: Format: compact passive Thunder subwoofer with 18" driver
Frequency response ~28 Hz – 150 Hz (-6 dB) with Thunder presets
Compact cube-like design to tuck under stages and platforms
Designed for use with Kommander amplifiers and Thunder processing
Ideal for clubs, immersive rooms and under-balcony reinforcement
Matches KSC and KS aesthetics for cohesive system design
